comments:
Eclipse version I'm working in: 3.0 I20031126
Eclipse version I have set up as target platform (in PDE preferences and plugins
in workspace): 2.1.2
Target is compiled with 1.3 compliance level and run with Sun's 1.3.1.

I select my test (RenamePackageTest.java, from jdt.ui.tests.refactoring) and
create a new "JUnit Plug-in Test" launch configuration. When I try to run it, I
get a launch error dialog, telling me to look at the .log.

I have org.eclipse.ui.workbench (the default) as application name, but others
yield the same error.

The .log of the target workspace:

What projects do you have in your workspace, and what external plug-ins are 
enabled on the Target Platform pref page?

I imported org.eclipse.jdt.ui, all required projects + org.junit as binary.
Then, I replaced org.eclipse.jdt.ui with the CVS-version of the maintenance
branch and also checked out org.eclipse.jdt.ui and org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests from
CVS.

I have disabled all external plugins, but enabling them doesn't change anything.

I see what the problem is:
The 3.0 JUnit UI application class is supposed to handle both 3.0 and 2.1 
platforms.  However, the class implements ITestHarness which is not part of 
2.1's org.eclipse.ui plug-in, so it chokes when running against 2.1 platform.

For backward compatibility, we need to create a separate application class to 
handle pre-2.1 platforms.

Until this bug is fixed, please use 3.0M4 as your development workbench when 
testing a 2.1.x platform.

Fixed in >20031205
To verify, I ran all JDT UI tests from the 2_1_x maintenance branch against a 
2.1.2 target platform.
The tests ran fine 1254/1272 passed.  8 failures. 10 errors.
